intro: Godetia willdenowiana, commonly known as the common godetia, is an annual flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant produces showy, bright yellow flowers with five petals, often arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and ease of growth.
